page.title: 07HELSBY HILL
page.content: Helsby Hill faces west.The village is at the bottom of the hill.You can see the hill from nearly every part of the village.There is a sort of cap hanging over the rock face.The hill is made of sandstone which was used to build churches and the Liverpool Docks.There are quarries where people have dug out the stone. The hill belongs to the National Trust which own many famous houses and natural beauty spots.There are lots of tracks that lead up to the top of the hill.There is one on Old Chester Road between two houses. Rock climbers climb the rock face particuarly at the weekends and during the summer.There are hill races every year.It is used by joggers and people who walk their dogs. Also in Autumn the children of Helsby collect conkers there.
